Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
May 11, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all of
the following information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
2

(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the completion of the
probationary period or within 180 days, whichever is
less, and a written evaluation of the employee’s
performance annually thereafter.
Three of six new employee files did not have a written evaluation completed on
time.
CCI Rule 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(1) An initial health screening shall be completed for
each resident within 24 hours of admission to a facility.
One of three youth files reviewed lacked an initial health screening.
CCI Rule 400.4146 Immunizations
(1) A resident shall have current immunizations as
required by the department of community health.
Two of three youth files reviewed lacked documentation of current immunizations.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
3

The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility had 14 special investigations during this period under review, with three
investigations finding rule violations. The corrective action plans addressed an
unwarranted restraint, a staff member not following the facility's code of conduct,
and a youth being sent home on the weekend without enough medications. The
facility's corrective action plan compliance is monitored quarterly, and they have
completed all current corrective action plans.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the annual financial
report.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported staff turnover at the facility and now having a
young group of workers that are trying to meld together. There are now two
supervisors, one assigned to each house, rather than one supervisor covering both
houses. The Chief Administrator stated this change was made to help the
programs be more consistent. The facility has raised the pay rate and increased
recruiting efforts, but staffing continues to be an issue.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The majority of the staff reported having a solid group of youth specialists working
at the facility. Staff indicated there was a lot of turnover, but through hard work,
mentoring and modeling from veteran staff the group is working better together.
One staff reported staff are not supervising youth, policies within the facility are not
being followed and being fearful speaking up on these issues. An investigation into
this staff member's concerns is currently taking place, special investigation number
2023C0000451.
Youth reported in interviews feeling safe with staff, understanding the expectations
of the house and having their needs met. One youth reported not liking the taste
of some of the food provided but stated an alternative is provided by staff. There
were no concerns noted by youth interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of both houses occurred on May 10, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
